Mathematics.title: Pythagorean Theorem
Mathematics.description: Relates the lengths of the sides of a right triangle.

Mathematics.title: Euler's Identity
Mathematics.description: An equation combining five fundamental mathematical constants.

Mathematics.title: Quadratic Formula
Mathematics.description: Gives the solutions to the quadratic equation ax^2 + bx + c = 0.

Mathematics.title: Newton's Second Law of Motion
Mathematics.description: Describes the relationship between force, mass, and acceleration.

Mathematics.title: Gaussian Integral
Mathematics.description: Calculates the integral of the Gaussian function.

Physics.title: Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation
Physics.description: Describes the gravitational attraction between two masses.

Physics.title: Einstein's Mass-Energy Equivalence
Physics.description: Relates mass and energy in the context of relativity.

Physics.title: Ohm's Law
Physics.description: Defines the relationship between voltage, current, and resistance in a conductor.

Physics.title: Maxwell's Equations
Physics.description: A set of fundamental equations describing electromagnetic phenomena.

Physics.title: Schrodinger's Equation
Physics.description: Fundamental equation in quantum mechanics describing the wave function of a quantum system.

Chemistry.title: Ideal Gas Law
Chemistry.description: Relates the pressure, volume, and temperature of an ideal gas.

Chemistry.title: Henderson-Hasselbalch Equation
Chemistry.description: Relates the pH of a buffer solution to the pKa and the ratio of the concentrations of the conjugate acid and base.

Chemistry.title: Nernst Equation
Chemistry.description: Relates the equilibrium potential of a cell to the concentrations of its ions.

Chemistry.title: Gibbs Free Energy
Chemistry.description: Describes the thermodynamic potential of a system to do work.

Chemistry.title: Arrhenius Equation
Chemistry.description: Describes the temperature dependence of reaction rates.

Chemistry.title: Hess's Law
Chemistry.description: States that the change in enthalpy in a chemical reaction is independent of the pathway between the initial and final states.

Chemistry.title: Beer-Lambert Law
Chemistry.description: Describes the relationship between the absorption of light and the properties of the material through which the light is traveling.

Chemistry.title: Pauli Exclusion Principle
Chemistry.description: States that no two identical fermions can occupy the same quantum state simultaneously.

Chemistry.title: Avogadro's Law
Chemistry.description: States that equal volumes of gases, at the same temperature and pressure, contain the same number of molecules.

Chemistry.title: Law of Conservation of Mass
Chemistry.description: States that the mass of an isolated system remains constant over time.
Chemistry.expression: \text{Total mass of products} = \text{Total mass of reactants}
